text: :eyes:

It looks like the cookie managing requirements as outlined by the EU's GDRP were updated on May 4, 2020 and the current HS cooking management tool might not cover all of the needs. Are there any plans in the works to update this with more detailed management options similar to that which are seen in third party tools such as Cookiebot?
We have the same issue, went for a custom implementation instead.
I have used URL redirects to created some manual redirection rules but those are not working at my end. Any leads?

Hi guys, when creating dynamic pages on HubSpot via HubDB, how can you implement a Next and Previous functionality? For instance I clicked on a Project item to show me more info about the project and inside that page I want to be redirected to the next or previous project. I have Googled everywhere but I couldn't find any answers, is this even possible? I have attached a screenshot for reference.
That is were we are heading. Would be great to see an integrated option
I’ve filed an issue to consider re-evaluating this. That said the javascript solution above will work.
It would be cool to have a priority argument in the `require_js` function, or have `js_assets` accept external js file addresses

Hey guys,
I have a problem with HubSpot form. I am embedding HubSpot form code into wordpress page and it shows inside iframe. How can I prevent it from iframe rendering?
 Any idea??
turn off the styling
style it using css
From where I can turn off styling?
is it possible to change the animation speed of the native "animate to anchor" - Animation in HubSpot?
its in the js file

Is there a way to print out tag names from hubdb api that is included into a table via a foreign key? when I see the json data, All I see for the data for the foreign key item is this: {id: 33507870245, type: “foreignid”} but not the actual multi-selected tags that where added thru a foreign key in another hubDB
Having the name as well as the Id would be awesome...
like I would expect this output:
{‘tag1’, ‘tag2’}
Having the id is useful but it would be nice if each one was an object that had the name as well
is this not possible at this time when trying to access data thru the foreign key?
No it's not
so then what good is the foreign key in the hubdb api if printing out the cross referenced tags will not show up?
Ah. I see what your trying to do.
Have you tried pprint?
I am using js
using fetch api to get my data async
not using hubl but rather json and js is this possible?
Hmm.
It's been a tick since I did that.
